title: Five Best: On Decline and Fall
sub_head: From Adrian Wooldridge, co-author of ‘The Wake-Up Call: Why the Pandemic Has Exposed the Weakness of the West, and How to Fix It.’
body:
By David Landes (1998)
1. In 1500, China was the world’s most sophisticated and self-confident power, “first in size and population,” as David Landes puts it, “first in age and experience, untouchable in its cultural achievement and sense of moral, spiritual, and intellectual superiority.” By 1900 it was the playground of European companies and empires. Landes is as penetrating on China’s decline as he is on the West’s rise. The civil-service examinations tested the same Confucian classics...
